etymology.description: 喇(喇) (lǎ, "horn; sound of a trumpet") and 叭(叭) (bā, "trumpet sound") combine to form "喇叭(喇叭)" (lǎbā, "horn; trumpet").
etymology.interpretation: The word 喇叭(喇叭) (lǎbā, "horn; trumpet") consists of two components both associated with sound or musical noise, emphasizing the loud, attention-grabbing effect of a horn or trumpet.

examples.chinese: 司机按喇叭叫停闯红灯的人(司機按喇叭叫停闖紅燈的人)。
examples.pinyin: Sījī àn lǎbā jiào tíng chuǎng hóngdēng de rén.
examples.english: The driver honked the horn to stop the person running a red light.

examples.chinese: 音乐会上(音樂會上)，喇叭和小号演奏出激昂的旋律(喇叭和小號演奏出激昂的旋律)。
examples.pinyin: Yīnyuè huì shàng, lǎbā hé xiǎohào yǎnzòu chū jī'áng de xuánlǜ.
examples.english: At the concert, the horn and the trumpet played an inspiring melody.
